name: Caldo de Pollo
author: jack&lanasmommy
summary: This is my first attempt at making caldo de pollo. I think it turned out great. You might need to add salt to taste as my recipe doesn't have very much. I like to serve this with warm corn tortillas and a side of Spanish rice and refried beans. Please enjoy and let me know what you think.
ingredients: 4 large carrots, peeled and cut into large chunks
4 large potatoes, peeled and cut into large chunks
1 large white onion, cut into large chunks
directions: Place chicken legs into a large stock pot and pour water over chicken; add garlic, salt, and garlic powder
Cover, bring to a boil, and reduce heat to low
Simmer until chicken meat falls off the bones, 1 to 2 hours
Stir in chicken bouillon cube and let dissolve
Mix carrots, potatoes, zucchini, chayote, and white onion in the broth, turn heat to medium-low, and cook soup at a low boil until carrots and potatoes are tender, 45 minutes to 1 hour
Stir chopped cilantro into soup, simmer for 5 minutes, and serve
